alignment module¶

src.cyto.alignment.align_samples_func(ch, q_alignment, samples, aligned_samples, original_samples, Loc_Ref_Dict_All_Ch, Loc_Morph_Ref_Dict_All_Ch, Ref_Inv_CDF_Dict_All_Ch, funcs_dict, comp_func_dict, earth_models_dict, gates_locations_dict, n_sample, sigma, earth_smoothing_penalty, subsample_ratio=1, in_place_eval=True, verbose=False)[source]¶

Transforms channel ch unaligned data to aligned data based on the provided references and fills in the provided aligned samples dictionary.

Parameters

  • ch – int, channel number.

  • q_alignment – float. A quantile value for robust alignment. Instead of matching min and max values of reference, the function matches q_alignment and 1-q_alignment quantiles.

  • samples – list(Sample), a list of all samples in data as Sample objects.

  • aligned_samples – dict, a dictionary of numpy.array(dtype=float) aligned_samples, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • original_samples – dict, a dictionary of numpy.array(dtype=float) original_samples, morphology groups for each channel with channels numbers as its keys.

  • Loc_Ref_Dict_All_Ch – dict, a dictionary of Gate chosen reference gates for all channels with channels numbers as its keys.

  • Loc_Morph_Ref_Dict_All_Ch – dict, a dictionary of dictionaries of Gate chosen morphology reference gates for all channels with (channel number, location group) tupel as its keys.

  • funcs_dict – dict, a dictionary of list warping functions for each gate in a channel of a sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • comp_func_dict – dict, a dictionary of function combined warping functions for each channel in each sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • Ref_Inv_CDF_Dict_All_Ch – dict, a dictionary of dictionaries of :obj:`tuple(function, function) of reference gates ecdf and inverse cdf respectively.

  • earth_models_dict – dict, a dictionary of pyearth.Earth MARS models for each channel in each sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • gates_locations_dict – dict, a dictionary of list location of gates, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • n_sample – obj:int, number os samples to align.

  • sigma – float, the standard deviation of Gaussian kernel.

  • earth_smoothing_penalty – float, A smoothing parameter used to calculate generalized cross validation. Used during the pruning pass and to determine whether to add a hinge or linear basis function during the forward pass.

  • subsample_ratio – float, a number between [0,1]`, represents the ratio of cells to consider to estimate MARS parameters.

  • in_place_eval – Bool, if True, aligns data within.

  • verbose – Bool, if True, prints all information about all gates in each channel in sample.

Returns

  • comp_func_dict - dict, a dictionary of function combined warping functions for each channel in each sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • funcs_dict - dict, a dictionary of list warping functions for each gate in a channel of a sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

  • earth_models_dict - dict, a dictionary of pyearth.Earth MARS models for each channel in each sample, with its keys is represented as the tupel (sample number, channel).

src.cyto.alignment.combine_funcs(model, xs_ys, funcs, locations, sigma, subsample_ratio=1, plot=True, ax=None)[source]¶

Creates a combined function of MARS model and every segments transformations.

Parameters

  • model – pyearth.Earth MARS model.

  • xs_ys – obj:list(list(numpy.array)), a list of x values and transformed y values in the form of [ [target_seg1, f(target_seg1)], [target_seg2, f(target_seg2)], …].

  • funcs – obj:list(function), a list of warping functions for each segment.

  • locations – obj:list(tuple), a list of tuples that contain the start and end range of each function.

  • sigma – float, the standard deviation of Gaussian kernel.

  • subsample_ratio – float, a number between [0,1]`, represents the ratio of cells to consider to estimate MARS parameters.

  • plot – Bool, if True, plots warping functions.

  • ax – matplotlib.axes.Axes, axes to draw on. If None, a new axes is created.

Returns

function, the complete warping function for a sample’s channel including its MARS regression model for extrapolation.

src.cyto.alignment.combined(x, model, funcs, locations, sigma, only_use_MARS=False)[source]¶

The final combined function of MARS model and segments transformations.

Parameters

  • x – numpy.array(dtype=float), shape = [1, n], A 1-D array containing target data.

  • model – model: pyearth.Earth MARS model.

  • funcs – obj:list(function), a list of warping functions for each segment.

  • locations – obj:list(tuple), a list of tuples that contain the start and end range of each function.

Returns

y: numpy.array(dtype=float), shape = [1, n], A 1-D array containing transformed target data.

src.cyto.alignment.compute_cdf_and_inv_cdf(ref_gate, k=3)[source]¶

Computes the CDF and Inverse CDF of a gate. (typically for a reference gate)

Parameters

  • ref_gate – Gate, reference gate.

  • k – int, BSpline degree (default =3).

Returns

  • ref_ecdf - function, reference Empirical Cumulative distribution function.

  • ref_inv_cdf - function, reference inverse Cumulative distribution function.

src.cyto.alignment.estimate_alignment_funcs_for_target(ch, target_sample, q_alignment, Loc_Ref_Dict_All_Ch, Ref_Dict_indx_by_Loc_and_Morph, Ref_CDF_and_InvCDF, verbose)[source]¶

Estimates transformations/functions for each gate to align target_sample to provided references.

Parameters

  • ch – int, channel number

  • target_sample – Sample. target sample.

  • q_alignment – float. A quantile value for robust alignment. Instead of matching min and max values of reference, the function matches q_alignment and 1-q_alignment quantiles.

  • Loc_Ref_Dict_All_Ch – dict, a dictionary of Gate chosen reference gates for all channels with channels numbers as its keys.

  • Loc_Morph_Ref_Dict_All_Ch – dict, a dictionary of dictionaries of Gate chosen morphology reference gates for all channels with (channel number, location group) tupel as its keys.

  • Ref_CDF_and_InvCDF – dict, a dictionary of :obj:`tuple(function, function), of reference gates ecdf and inverse cdf respectively.

  • verbose – Bool, if True, prints all information about all gates in each channel in sample.

Returns

  • funcs - list(functions), a list of estimated funcs per gate. If no reference was found for a particular gate, a None is put in place of to be replaced by MARS.

  • xys - list(tuple), a list of tuples (x, y), where x is a 1D array representing the input value of each gate, and y is its estimated (transformed) counterpart.

  • gates_locations - list(tuple), a list of tuples (left boundary, right boundary).

  • sample_orignal - numpy.array, original sample.

src.cyto.alignment.get_smooth_and_monotonic(t, y)[source]¶

A convolution-based transform to ensure smoothness and monotonicity.

Parameters

  • y –

Returns

src.cyto.alignment.lambda_IPT_factory(ref_inv_cdf, target_ecdf)[source]¶

A factory method for Inverse Probability Transform. The reason why it is necessary to have this kind of factory/additional layer is that python lambdas do not store default hyperparamters for non-primitive data types and will access the most recent parameters in its closure. By having a factory, we ensure that parameters are snapshotted in the scope of the factory and the returned lambda closure has its own unique hyperparameters.

Parameters

  • ref_inv_cdf – function, inverse empirical cumulative distribution function (ECDF) of reference segment

  • target_ecdf – function, ECDF of target segment.

Returns

function, inverse probability transform.

src.cyto.alignment.linear_reg_inter(ymean, xmean, x0, y0)[source]¶

  • xmean –

  • x0 –

src.cyto.alignment.minmaxmean_align(x, y, mi, mx, q_alignment, func0=None)[source]¶

Creates a warping function that soft aligns target boundaries and mean oto corresponding reference values.

Parameters

  • x – numpy.array(dtype=float), shape = [1, n], A 1-D array containing target data.

  • y – numpy.array(dtype=float), shape = [1, n], A 1-D array containing reference data.

  • mi – float, reference segment left quantile.

  • mx – float, reference segment right quantile.

  • q_alignment – float. A quantile value for robust alignment. Instead of matching min and max values of reference, the function matches q_alignment and 1-q_alignment quantiles.

  • func0 – :obj:`function, the transformation that needs to be applied before the minmax_alignment, typically the inverse probability transform.

Returns

function, a warping function that aligns the boundaries of target to reference gates.
